required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ABBV-428, an Immunotherapy, in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Phase 1, Open-Label, Dose-Escalation Study of ABBV-428, an Immunotherapy, in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, Phase I, dose-escalation study to determine the recommended Phase 2 dose (RPTD), maximum tolerated dose (MTD), and evaluate the safety and pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of ABBV-428 when administered as monotherapy or in combination with nivolumab in participants with advanced solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug through at least 100 days after end of treatment; up to 2 years after last participants first dose

primary_outcome.measure: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RPTD) of ABBV-428 when administered as monotherapy or in combination with nivolumab
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day of study drug administration within the 28-day cycle at the designated cohort dose
primary_outcome.description: If a maximum tolerated dose (MTD) is reached, the RPTD of ABBV-428 will not be a dose higher than the defined MTD, and will be selected based on the type(s) and occurrence(s) of dose limiting toxicities which occur in addition to the MTD. If a MTD is not reached, then the RPTD will be defined based on the safety and pharmacokinetic data.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum concentration-time curve (AUC) of ABBV-428
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after a 24-month treatment period
Up to 30 days after a 24-month treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed serum concentration (Cmax) of ABBV-428
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after a 24-month treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of ABBV-428 when administered as monotherapy or in combination with nivolumab
primary_outcome.description: The highest dose level at which less than 2 of 6 participants or less than 33% of (if cohort is expanded beyond 6) participants experience a dose limiting toxicity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after a 24-month treatment period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after a 24-month of treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: DOR defined as the time from the initial objective response to disease progression or death, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after a 24-month of treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: CBR defined as the proportion of subjects with a confirmed partial response (PR), complete response (CR), or stable disease for at least 24 weeks to the treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after a 24-month of treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: PFS time is defined as the time from the first dose of ABBV-428 to disease progression or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after a 24-month of treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of subjects with a confirmed partial or complete response to the treatment.

arm_group.description: ABBV-428 will be administered at escalating dose levels in 28-day dosing cycles (2 doses per cycle).
Additional participants (with ovarian cancer, NSCLC, etc.) will be enrolled in a dose expansion cohorts that will further evaluate ABBV-428.
Additional participants with NSCLC will be enrolled in an expansion cohort that will further evaluate ABBV-428 plus nivolumab.

intervention.description: ABBV-428 will be administered by intravenous infusion in 28-day dosing cycles on Day 1 and Day 15.
Nivolumab will be administered by intravenous infusion according to approved dose and dosing schedules.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must have an advanced solid tumor that has progressed on standard therapies known to provide clinical benefit or the participants are intolerant to such therapies.
- Participants have adequate bone marrow, renal, hepatic and coagulation function.
- For all dose expansion arms, participants must have measurable disease per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) Version 1.1
- Participants in combination therapy cohorts must have an advanced solid tumor where the use of nivolumab is standard therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active or prior documented autoimmune disease in the last 2 years. Participants with childhood atopy or asthma, vitiligo, alopecia, Hashimoto syndrome, Grave's disease, or psoriasis not requiring systemic treatment (within the past 2 years) are not excluded.
- Current or prior use of immunosuppressive medication within 14 days prior to the first dose (with certain exceptions).
- History of primary immunodeficiency, bone marrow transplantation, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, solid organ transplantation, or previous clinical diagnosis of tuberculosis.
- Confirmed positive test results for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), or participants with chronic or active hepatitis B or C. Participants who have a history of hepatitis B or C who have undetectable HBV DNA or HCV RNA after anti-viral therapy may be enrolled.
- Prior grade greater than or equal to 3 immune-mediated neurotoxicity or pneumonitis (or any other unresolved or symptomatic adverse event in the last 3 months) while receiving immunotherapy.
- Male participants who are considering fathering a child or donating sperm during the study or for at least 3 or 5 months (for monotherapy and combination therapy participants, respectively) after the last dose of study drug.
